edu.uiuc.ncsa.security.util.mail

Class MailUtil

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.uiuc.ncsa.security.util.configuration.TemplateUtil
      • edu.uiuc.ncsa.security.util.mail.MailUtil
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Logable

    public class MailUtil
extends TemplateUtil
implements Logable
    A utility for sending messages via SMTP or SMTPS using Java mail.

    Created by Jeff Gaynor
    on 10/5/11 at 1:18 PM

    • Field Detail

      • LEFT_DELIMITER

        public static String LEFT_DELIMITER
        The left-hand delimiter for replacements in templates. Must make a valid regex when combined with the key and right-hand delimiter.

      • RIGHT_DELIMITER

        public static String RIGHT_DELIMITER
        The right-hand delimiter for replacements in templates. Must make a valid regex when combined with the left-hand delimiter and key.

      • ADDRESS_SEPARATOR

        public static String ADDRESS_SEPARATOR
        The separator between email addresses. The default is a semi-colon.

      • getMailEnvironment

      • sendMessage

        public boolean sendMessage(String subjectTemplate,
                           String messageTemplate,
                           Map replacements)
        This allows for sending with a specific subject and message template. This is useful for internally generated messages that may need a lot of customization on the fly. Remember that a template has string delimited with ${KEY} which the replacements map (KEY, VALUE pairs) will render into VALUES.
        Parameters:
        subjectTemplate -
        messageTemplate -
        replacements -
        Returns:

      • sendMessage

        public boolean sendMessage(Map replacements)
        This takes a map of replacements for the templates and sends the message.

        This will return a true if the message succeeded and a false otherwise. It will not cause a failure outright, since a failed notification should not bring down your server.

        Parameters:
        replacements -
        Returns:
